the sensor data the test criteria that is often used as a physical bench standard typical variances in the sensor
measurements are less than 1% and this information is typically provided by the
technology manufacturer themselves in
contrast validation assures that the process data are suitable for the intended use and patient population in a
trial validation is really a biological assessment the assessment of the
accuracy and precision of the biological endpoints that are derived from the sensor data this is usually measured
against an independent standard unlike verification variances and endpoint
measurements can be very large but still can be useful and this ends up being a statistical question validation can be
provided by the device manufacturer themselves an independent study by a user or a new study for a specific
patient population ultimately the study sponsor is responsible for ensuring that the chosen
measures are appropriate for use in a trial at this point let's walk through
